column1: This course contributes to developing the responsible manager of tomorrow by introducing the student to critical statistical thinking, to the sound application of statistics to societal and business data, and the use of statistical information in making decisions that drive a positive change in a complex world.

Everyday practice in business and management is characterized by decision making in situations with uncertainty. Statistics is the tool to handle this uncertainty and to help in making the appropriate decisions. This course gives an introduction to statistics with illustrative business applications. The online lecture-clips treat the basic statistical concepts and methods, and at home you can practice by making exercises to apply the methods to real-world business problems. The treated topics are:
The course is practically oriented towards solving business problems in four steps:

column2: • formulate the problem in terms of statistics
• interpret the results (what does the solution mean for the problem at hand)
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: At the end of this course the student is able to demonstrate:

column2: • knowledge and understanding of (the difference between) descriptive and inferential statistics (as well as the role that probability plays in inference) and the four levels of measurement of variables

• knowledge and understanding of the most well-known graphical descriptive techniques and measures of (central and non-central) location and spread, as well as mastery of the application of these concepts to societal and business data
• knowledge and understanding of three ways of assigning probabilities, as well as the difference between discrete and continuous random variables (and their probability distributions)
• knowledge and understanding of the basic concepts and rules of probability, as well as mastery of the application of these rules to societal and business data
• knowledge and understanding of the most well-known probability distributions and sampling distributions, as well as mastery of the application of these distributions to societal and business data

• knowledge and understanding of the basic concepts of (parameter) estimation and the most well-known confidence interval estimators, as well as mastery of the application of these concepts to societal and business data

• knowledge and understanding of the basic concepts of hypothesis testing, and the most well-known test statistics and their distributions, as well as mastery of the application of these concepts to societal and business data
• a critical mind-set and an awareness of ethical and normative ways of thinking in applying statistics
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The structure of the course primarily consists of 4 online lectures (collection of lecture-clips that can be watched at home in advance) in which the basic statistical concepts and methods are discussed. This is followed by independently making exercises at home. Online video-clips will be used of lectures of the course Statistics in the bachelor programme International Business Administration. PP slides of the lectures as well as solutions of the self-study exercises will be made available on Canvas. In addition, an overview will be provided which indicates exactly which video-clip can be watched (again), if necessary, to make a specific self-study exercise. In this way, the course Statistics can be followed completely at your own pace. Weekly (4x) there will be a Q&A session via Zoom + kick off meeting.

column1: A typical phenomenon in empirical research is the wish to make statements about an unobservable population on the basis of an observed sample.

The course Statistics aims to facilitate the construction of statistical statements about the population on the basis of a random sample. The statements may concern statistical estimates or statistical hypothesis tests. Moreover, the statistical statements are typically accompanied by information concerning the level of (un)certainty.

In this course, the construction of ""good"" estimators and ""good"" tests in parametrical statistical models is considered. In particular, we will focus on the construction of method of moments estimators, maximum likelihood estimators, (uniformly) most powerful tests and likelihood ratio tests.
This course uses knowledge of FEB21018X Introduction to Statistics and FEB21005X Probability Theory, and is required for FEB22003X Introduction Multivariate Statistics and FEB22004X Econometrics 1.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Students learn the basic principles of statistical estimation: point estimation, interval estimation, as well as properties of estimators such as bias, variance and consistency.

• Students learn the basic principles of statistical testing: formulating statistical hypotheses, constructing appropriate tests and the corresponding critical region, calculating p-values and properties of tests such as type I and type II errors, and the power of a test.
• Students are introduced to the theory of sufficient and complete statistics in order to apply those concepts in the construction of estimators with desirable properties.
• Students learn how to construct maximum likelihood estimators, method of moment estimators, most powerful tests and likelihood ratio tests.

column1: The course is intended for students who have a deficiency in probability and statistics. It starts off with the very first principles of probability and quickly passes on to essential statistical techniques. Estimation and testing theory will be reviewed, including maximum likelihood estimators, likelihood ratio test and (least squares) regression. The course is based on John A. Rice, Mathematical Statistics and Data Analysis, Duxbury Press, Belmont, California. All together the topics will be treated in 7 lectures. Students are required to study the corresponding theory and examples in the book as well as to make accompanying exercises.

The topics covered in the course are: Sample spaces, probability measures, distribution functions, random variables with discrete and continuous distributions, functions of random variables, multivariate distributions, random vectors, independent random variables, conditional distributions, functions of random vectors and their distributions, expectation and variance, covariance and correlation, the law of large numbers, central limit theorem, chi-square and t-distributions, estimation, method of moments, maximum likelihood, large sample theory, confidence intervals, Cramer-Rao bound, hypothesis testing, Neyman-Pearson paradigm, likelihood ratio tests, confidence intervals, linear regression, least squares estimation of regression parameters, testing regression hypotheses.</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: By the end of the course, students will be able to

column2: • understand the principles of probability and the essential statistical techniques;
• to apply fundamental techniques needed for statistical inference;
• to continue study and research on a more advanced level.

column1: Deze cursus draagt bij aan de ontwikkeling van de verantwoordelijke manager van morgen door de student kennis te laten maken met kritisch statistisch denken, de correcte toepassing van statistiek op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens, en het gebruik van statistische informatie bij het nemen van beslissingen die een positieve verandering in een complexe wereld bewerkstelligen.

De dagelijkse praktijk in het bedrijfsleven wordt vaak gekenmerkt door het nemen van beslissingen in onzekere situaties. Het vakgebied statistiek reikt instrumenten aan om met deze onzekerheid om te gaan en te helpen bij het nemen van de juiste beslissingen. Het vak Statistiek geeft een inleiding op het vakgebied statistiek met praktische toepassingen, veelal vanuit het bedrijfsleven. Tijdens de online video-colleges worden de statistische basisconcepten en methoden besproken, en thuis kan met behulp van opgaven worden geoefend om de aangereikte methoden toe te passen op praktische probleemsituaties. De behandelde onderwerpen zijn:
De cursus is praktisch gericht op het oplossen van (bedrijfs)problemen in vier stappen:
-      formuleer het probleem in termen van statistiek
-      los het probleem op (door handmatige berekening)
-      interpreteer de resultaten (wat betekent de oplossing voor het betreffende probleem)</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Na afloop van de cursus is de student in staat om aan te tonen:

-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van (het verschil tussen) beschrijvende en inferentiële statistiek (evenals de rol die kansrekening speelt bij inferentiële statistiek), en van de vier meetniveaus van variabelen

-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van de meest bekende grafische beschrijvende technieken en maatstaven van locatie en spreiding, alsmede aantonen deze concepten vaardig te kunnen toepassen op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens
-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van drie manieren om kansen toe te kennen, evenals van het verschil tussen discrete en continue kansvariabelen (en hun kansverdelingen)
-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van de basisbegrippen en rekenregels van de kansrekening, alsmede aantonen deze regels vaardig te kunnen toepassen op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens

-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van een aantal bekende kansverdelingen en trekkingsverdelingen, alsmede aantonen deze verdelingen vaardig te kunnen toepassen op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens

-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van de basisconcepten van (parameter)schatting en van de meest bekende betrouwbaarheidsintervalschatters, alsmede aantonen deze concepten vaardig te kunnen toepassen op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens

-      kennis en begrip te bezitten van de basisbegrippen van het toetsen van hypotheses en van de meest bekende toetsgrootheden en hun kansverdelingen, alsmede aantonen deze concepten vaardig te kunnen toepassen op maatschappelijke en bedrijfsgegevens
-      een kritische instelling en een bewustzijn van ethische en normatieve manieren van denken te bezitten bij de toepassing van statistiek

column1: De structuur van het vak bestaat primair uit 4 online hoorcolleges (verzameling college-clips die vooraf thuis bekeken kunnen worden) waarin de statistische basisconcepten en methodes worden behandeld. Dit wordt gevolgd door het zelfstandig thuis maken van oefenopgaven. Gebruik zal worden gemaakt van online video-clips van hoorcolleges van het vak Statistiek in de bacheloropleiding Bedrijfskunde. Op Canvas zullen PP-slides van de hoorcolleges alsmede uitwerkingen van de zelfstudieopgaven beschikbaar worden gesteld. Daarnaast zal een overzicht worden aangeboden waarin precies aangegeven wordt welke video-clip evt. (nogmaals) bekeken kan worden met het oog op het maken van een bepaalde zelfstudieopgave. Op deze wijze kan het vak Statistiek volledig in eigen tempo worden gevolgd. Wekelijks (4x) zal er een Q&A sessie zijn (on campus dan wel via Zoom) + kick-off hoorcollege.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Een typisch fenomeen in empirische wetenschappen is dat we uitspraken willen doen over een populatie, terwijl we slechts over een steekproef uit deze populatie beschikken. De populatie is zelf niet observeerbaar.

Het vak Statistiek richt zich op het doen van statistische uitspraken over een populatie aan de hand van een aselecte steekproef, hetzij via schatten, hetzij via toetsen. Statistische uitspraken zijn uitspraken die met hoge kans waar zijn. Als de populatie niet observeerbaar is, is het niet mogelijk om altijd geldende uitspraken te doen, en bieden statistische uitspraken een alternatief dat in de praktijk goed blijkt te werken.

Ook behandelt het vak de constructie van goede schatters en goede toetsen in parametrische statistische modellen, met name maximum likelihood schatters, meest onderscheidende toetsten en likelihood ratio toetsen.
Dit vak maakt gebruik van FEB21018 Inleiding Statistiek en FEB21005 Kansrekening, en is nodig voor FEB22003 Inleiding Multivariate Statistiek en FEB22004 Econometrie 1.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• De student leert de basisprincipes van schatten: puntschatten, intervalschatten en bias, variantie en consistentie van puntschatters.

• De student leert de basisprincipes van toetsen: formuleren van hypothesen, opstellen van geschikte testen en de bijbehorende kritiek gebieden, berekenen van p-waarden en type I en II fouten, onderscheidingsvermogen.
• De student maakt kennis met de theorie van voldoende en volledige grootheden, en weet deze theorie toe te passen bij het afleiden van meest nauwkeurige zuivere schatters.
• De student leert hoe in een parametrisch model maximum likelihood schatters, meest onderscheidende toetsen en likelihood ratio toetsen geconstrueerd kunnen worden.

column1: In dit vak komen drie statistische technieken aan de orde die vaak worden gebruikt voor de analyse van verbanden tussen meerdere variabelen tegelijkertijd. Dit betreft: variantie-analyse, lineaire regressie en logistische regressie. Deze technieken worden dan toegepast voor impact evaluatie, met als doel om op (quasi-)experimentele wijze beleidsveranderingen te evalueren. De keuze om juist deze technieken te behandelen is gebaseerd op de inhoud van wetenschappelijke tijdschriften die studenten geacht worden te kunnen begrijpen. De besproken technieken worden toegelicht met behulp van het softwareprogramma SPSS. Daarnaast gaat de student ook zelf aan de slag met SPSS in een aantal computerpractica.

column2: • Methoden van kennisverwerving met de nadruk op wetenschappelijke methodes volgens de empirische cyclus

• Inferentie van distributies: one-sample tests, matched pairs tests, tests voor twee gemiddelden en betrouwbaarheidsintervallen.

column1: Students will receive a self-paced SPSS-training during this practical, which will help them acquire basic data processing techniques. Four introductory sessions to SPSS have been scheduled. The sessions are scheduled in weeks 1-4 of the course. During each session, students will be doing several exercises. Some of these exercises will involve SPSS computer skills, e.g. data entry, merging data files, sorting, etc. Other exercises will be directed at applying statistical techniques to data such as calculating averages and performing t-tests. The SPSS part of the practical sessions is concluded by an exam.The purpose of the exam is to determine whether you have mastered the SPSS skills featured in the practical sessions. The exam consists of 20 problems for you to complete using SPSS. Only topics from the SPSS part of the practical sessions will be included in the exam.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Students will take an SPSS practical training after which they will have gained a basic command of a software program commonly used for data handling, i.e. SPSS. Specifically, this means that students will learn how to create their own datasets in SPSS and how to use SPSS to perform relevant data-handling techniques, such as computing new data, selecting data and merging datasets. Also, they will learn how obtain relevant descriptive statistics and how to perform different kinds of t-tests that are dealt with in the course (FSWPE1-032).

column1: In the course Strategic Business Plan students will create a strategic analysis and recommendation for a real-life company. You will do this in teams of five students. You will do multiple company visits, look for data about the market and environment of the company and finally hand in a well-researched and practically relevant report containing strategic advice – to the university, but also to the company.

Many students look back at the SBP as one of the most challenging and fun experiences of their BSc. It gives you practical experience in strategy consulting, an opportunity to put all of the skills you develop in your first year to the test, and a great insight into how business really ‘works’. Unfortunately, for some students SBP can be a frustrating experience, because they find out how difficult it can be to cooperate with team mates and real-life companies. The best tips we can give you to make the most out of this course, is to establish clear rules and arrangements with your team mates, and to start early in searching for an interesting company willing to work with you.

That is why, during block 2 and before the official start of the course, students need to do two qualifying assignments. These are ‘Team Formation’ and ‘Company Registration’. This means you need to form a team of five students and find a suitable company willing to cooperate with you. Companies need to meet certain criteria to be considered ‘suitable’. Failure to do the qualifying assignments means students cannot take part in the course. In block 2, two lectures will announce and explain these two assignments. Team registration is via SIN-Online/My Registrations and is open from 26th of October until 15th of November.

In blocks 3 and 4, you and your team will do 4 assignments. Through online videos, you will receive instructions about the assignment content. Before the deadlines of each of your assignments, you will have the opportunity to visit a ""Question Hour"" to ask questions of your tutor. Once your assignments are handed in, they will be presented in a seminar session to be discussed with other teams. You will also receive written feedback on the assignment from your tutor, which you must use to improve its content.
The content of these assignments will form the basis of your Final Report submitted at the end of the year</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

• apply project management skills including time management and planning.
• apply a limited set of strategic concepts and tools logically and consistently to a real-life case.
• understanding the limitations and applicability of different data sources for different analyses.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112628,2023,Strategic Decision-Making,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,['dr. H Fasaei'],,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Only 5 percent of our decisions come from rational and deliberate thinking. This means that only a tiny fraction of our decisions is conscious and intentional. The remaining 95 percent of our decisions are based on mental shortcuts, emotions, cognitive biases, and intuition. Becoming aware of those biases and mental shortcuts, the way they work on us as humans, and mastering how they could be used and managed in different situations and walks of life will make the process of decision making strategic and make the outcomes favorable. After all, we humans are predictably irrational. In this course we will delve into those aspects of irrationality in decision making and discuss how we could predict them and strategically manage them to make the outcomes of humans' decisions and decision-making process favorable: for ourselves as individuals, for organizations, and for the society.
The course will be delivered in a very interactive manner as we will have lots of experiments, cases, group discussions, debates, and presentations embedded in the course.

In order to have interesting sessions and to benefit from them to the fullest, you need to come to the class and be well-prepared. Beside the fact that the nature of the course is intense and highly interactive, there has been always a very high positive correlation between active engagement in team assignment preparations and in-class discussions and debates on the one hand, and final performance in the individual assignment on the other hand. Therefore, ultimate attendance, preparation and engagement in all sessions and all aspects of this course are vital to have an enjoyable journey, benefit from the learning style of the course, and perform well in the course including the final individual assignment.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Understand the importance of Strategic Decision Making and its underlying challenges

• Apply the theories and concepts of the course related to cognitive biases & heuristics, prospect theory, mental accounting, framing, persuasion & pre-suasion, and choice architecture to create impactful and strategic decisions with long-term benefits for individuals, organizations, and the society
• Evaluate various and novel ideas in the debates and discussions to develop viable and evidence-based solutions
• Collaborate effectively in teams by connecting different perspectives to find solutions
• Communicate novel ideas and critical points effectively and convincingly
• Create solutions for societal problems by navigating complexity in the field of strategic decision making

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112629,2023,Strategic Implementation and measurement: Evaluating strategic success.,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,['dr. AC Brown'],,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The course is structured to include a review of strategic statement development and deconstruct these by utilizing both company prepared reports, and external sources to analyze and describe organizational, management and operational performance within the different business units. In addition, it will explore structuring and implementation of different KPIs and related tools in assisting management to implement strategy across an organization. The course will explore the differences between corporate and divisional business strategies and how these can/should be operationalized, measured, and linked between them.

This course is a bridge between strategy theories and real-world management practices as most enterprises formulate strategy (es) and its employees attempt to follow and implement these. This module will assist students in identifying, evaluating and analyzing how strategies are created and utilizing different tools, evaluate management ability to implement (or not) it successfully.
This course is an elective at the end of the academic year and will expand/ add to previous strategy courses.
Highly recommended. Although course attendance is not compulsory, it is strongly recommended for all sessions.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Discuss the connection between the development of the business strategies, its operations and management’s effectiveness in implementing it
• Identify stakeholders and their roles in strategy formulation and implementation
• Describe the importance the tools available to be able to analyse an industry and/ or company’s strategy/ its creation and implementation in the marketplace
• Demonstrate the ability to find, evaluate, understand the importance of strategy in successful company performance

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112622,2023,Strategic Leadership and Corporate Governance,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,"['SL Darr, MSc']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: The shaping of today’s corporate governance landscape and the functioning of top management teams within it have become major topics of discussion especially in the last two decades. Interest in these topics has only intensified further by recent corporate failures in the United States, Europe and beyond. We have all heard of the failures of Enron, Wirecard and Ahold. This course reviews the issues that lay behind such management failures. It focuses on the behaviors of top management teams and boards of directors of large publicly-traded firms and on their roles in the strategic decision-making and corporate governance processes. In the course we will take a closer look at the actual governance practices of large corporations, the effects these practices have on corporate strategy and performance, and the strengths/weaknesses of prevalent corporate governance mechanisms that are increasingly used world-wide. The course will not only cover quintessential topics pertaining to strategic leadership and corporate governance, but will also cover more recent developments in the two areas.

In-person attendance is strongly recommended given the individual participation grade. Note, for students who have received approval from the Examination Board to attend the lecture sessions online, this is also applicable. The lecture sessions will be live-streamed.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• To critically understand the mechanisms used to govern publicly-traded firms
• To identify the criteria used to select top managers and board members
• To learn what functions boards perform and to identify the most critical issues faced in the boardroom
• To learn how to evaluate a firm’s strategic moves regarding shareholder value creation
• To assess the determinants including the benefits and drawbacks of a board’s involvement in strategic decision-making for top management
• To gauge the relative importance of key stakeholders for managerial decision-making
• To be able to listen, write, and speak effectively about various hot topics in the field of strategic leadership and corporate governance
• To be able to think critically with demonstrated talent for identifying, scrutinizing, and analyzing complex problems in the field of strategic leadership and corporate governance
• To be able to work with others in a professional manner while attempting to achieve a common goal

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/113781,2023,Strategic Management,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,['dr. K Kavusan'],,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Why do some firms perform better than others? How can some companies manage to adapt to new innovations, while others can`t? Strategic management aims to provide explanations to these questions by investigating how firms can organize their internal resources and capabilities to align them with the environment to achieve a competitive advantage. This course focuses on theories of competitive advantage, and analytical tools that managers can use to devise strategies for their businesses. We will discuss business-level strategies and their role in creating a competitive advantage. We will also explore how new innovations can disrupt competition dynamics and how firms can respond to the emergence of new technologies and new competitors who capitalize on these technologies. We will also explore how strategic alliances and acquisitions can help companies to advance their capabilities and enhance their competitive advantage. At each step, there will be a healthy mix of theory and its application in real-life situations.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Define strategy and its purpose and differentiate between the economic logic of different business-level strategies
• Compare industrial organization and resource-based views and their alternative explanations of a competitive advantage
• Appraise the potential of a company`s strategy to create competitive advantage using five-forces and resource-based views
• Develop an innovation strategy involving internal efforts, acquisitions, and alliances to enhance and maintain a competitive advantage
• Formulate a comprehensive strategy for an organization in light of its external and internal conditions with a clear proposition for competitive advantage

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112621,2023,Strategic Management Honours Class,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,['dr. EJ Klitsie'],,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: As part of the Master program in Strategic Management, every year we organize the Honours Course in Strategic Management. The Honours course is a selective programme during which a limited number of excellent MSc SM students is given the opportunity to earn extra course credit, and an honours class certificate in addition to the MSc degree certificate.

The overarching theme of the course this year is “Strategy Formulation & Advice”, which will be addressed by carrying out a high stakes consulting assignment for a real client. This project is supported by intensive coaching consultants from top consulting firm Monitor Deloitte. In addition, theoretical support will be given in the form of workshops organized by the department of Strategy and Entrepreneurship. In other words, it promises to be a very exciting course!
The central challenge is to advise this client about its strategic challenge.

This elective requires mandatory attendance. Given the interactive nature and the importance of skill development, attendance mandatory for the workshops offered on campus, as well as external client meetings and consulting coaching sessions.

You may miss a contact moment if you deem it necessary. If you are absent, it is your responsibility to let the course coordinator know, and to catch up later, and make sure that you do your share of the group work. This course involves high stakes for students, clients, lecturers and consultants alike. As Honours students, you are expected to understand and respect that. The other side of the medal is that we respect your time and decisions, and many issues can be solved with timely notice.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• To create a strategic advice for a business entity.
• To evaluate critical concepts, tools and outcomes of strategy formulation and strategic management.
• To learn from high-level managers in the field.
• To analyze what challenges occur when formulating and strengthening a strategic model.
• To apply strategy formulation in a real-life situation.
• To understand the importance of persuasive tools and skills when working to realize a strategy.
• To apply tools and methods for formulating strategy.
• To create an advice that will be carried out.
• To build a strong network of (c-level) managers, consultants and academic relations.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/112598,2023,Strategic Management PT,Nederlands,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,"['dr. JJ Nijholt', 'prof.dr. TH Reus']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Strategie kan gedefinieerd worden als de lange-termijn richting van een organisatie. Strategische keuzes gaan over fit tussen de eigen resources en capabilities en de omgeving. Deze keuzes beïnvloeden het succes van bedrijven en de vraag of zij in staat zijn om concurrentievoordeel te behalen. Dit vak gaat dus over de bronnen van concurrentievoordeel en de analytische tools die managers in staat stellen om een corporate- en business-level strategie voor het eigen bedrijf te formuleren.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Het onderwerp strategie te definiëren, het onderscheid tussen operationele, business-level en corporate strategie te maken en de strategische keuzes op deze niveaus te onderscheiden
• De omgeving van organisatie te analyseren in termen van kansen en bedreigingen
• De strategic capabilities van een organisatie te analyseren in termen van sterktes en zwaktes
• Te analyseren op welke wijze competitieve strategieën bijdragen aan concurrentievoordeel
• Te verklaren hoe strategie gevormd wordt in de context van strategic purpose, upper echelons, stakeholders, en cultuur van een organisatie
• Te analyseren hoe strategische beslissingen op het gebied van diversificatie, internationalisering en innovatie bijdragen aan groei en concurrentievoordeel

column1: In this course, students will have insights on:

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Understand the role of analytical techniques and their ability to enhance marketing decision-making in modern enterprises
• View marketing processes and relationships systematically and analytically
• Expose you to various examples that demonstrate the value of marketing analytics in real managerial contexts.

column1: Strategic Mass Communication (SMC) is a lecture-based course with online mini-seminars. Its purpose is to introduce students to the different forms of SMC, such as Propaganda, Public relations, Public diplomacy, Nation branding, Political communication and Psychological operations. The way organizations, especially non-profit, use SMC will be analyzed through historical and contemporary case studies to understand the importance of storytelling and specific techniques. SMC will focus on the importance of creativity and a thorough understanding of various sources of information for a targeted audience. The course will analyze the role of strategic mass communication in maximizing the impact of messages and products. Practitioners will share their experience with students during guest lectures. The final paper will either be an analysis of a contemporary case study, or a more creative design of a campaign.
The purpose of SMC is also to help students as citizens to understand how mass communication has an impact on their daily lives.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Current theoretical perspectives, approaches, and practices in strategic mass communication
• Analyze, elaborate and critically reflect on mass communication strategies for commercial and non-profit organizations.

column1: Whether you’re a future employee, consultant, manager, leader or HR professional, people management is important to you. It is through people that most organisations create value – for the organization but also for other stakeholders. But what does the famous phrase “our people are our most valuable asset” really mean? What is value and where does it come from?

In this course we will look at questions such as; how can we manage people in a way to enhance both organisational performance and employee wellbeing? How can we ensure that our people management practices align to the goals of the organization and constantly changing external demands? What is the role of people management in 21st century organisations?

This is a highly interactive course which blends recorded knowledge clips with face-to-face discussion, guest speakers, and active participation in small group activities. In class you will be guided through activities which focus on testing theory, and you will apply your new knowledge in the MSc consultancy project. Through this you will work with a real organisation to analyse key strategic people-related problems and make evidence-based recommendations for how to address these. You are encouraged to be critical and inquisitive, and by the end of the course our goal is that you will be able to turn research into practice to create value through people management.
This course is an essential part of your MSc education.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• Describe how and why people management contributes to organisational and individual goals (POC expert; critical thinker)
• Evaluate which people management practices are appropriate in which situations (POC expert; critical thinker)

• Critically evaluate the role of strategic people management in creating “decent work and sustainable economic growth” (UN sustainable development goal 8) (POC expert; positive change agent; critical thinker)
• Integrate Strategic People Management knowledge into a real-life organisational context, as part of the MSc consultancy project (POC expert; collaborator; critical thinker)

column1: <body>In this course students will learn about the use of strategic management as one of the core elements of the management of public organizations. The course centers on strategic management as (1) an integrated management cycle consisting of strategy analysis, formulation, implementation and evaluation as well as (2) a social process consisting of complex interactions between managers, professionals, clients, and politicians. Thus, the course addresses the strategic management of (international) public organizations as a practice, something that public managers ‘do’. The course pays attention to global developments in public management, such as Weberian Bureaucracy, New Public Management and New Public Governance, but also addresses strategic issues that public organizations are confronted with while thinking about their strategy. Although strategic management is the core focus of this course, we will discuss several important public management topics that are closely related to the use of strategic management in public organizations, such as public accountability, stakeholder- and network management, and the role of street-level bureaucrats.</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: <body>After completion of the course, students should be able to...1.... compare the various global public management traditions (Weberian Bureaucracy, New Public Management, New Public Governance) that make up the context in which public organizations use strategic management; 2.... explain strategic public management as a social process that takes place in both the internal as well as the external environment of public organizations;3.... illustrate how relevant public management concepts such as accountability and stakeholder management work in the various aspects of the strategic management cycle, by giving concrete examples;4.... apply strategic management tools taught in class to concrete cases of (international) public organizations;5.... design a strategic plan according to the strategic management cycle, by making use of the various strategic management tools discussed in class.</body>

column1: <body>Studenten worden geacht in groepen een analyse te maken van de inhoud en het functioneren van een strategisch plan van een door hen te kiezen publieke organisatie</body>

column1: <body>The course is divided into three modules, which follow on from each other. Each module runs for three weeks and focuses on the distinct but interconnected themes of Planning Approaches, Urban Visions and Frictions, and Strategic Policy and Decision-Making. Each module culminates with a graded assignment that tests students on the topics covered in recently concluded, as well as previous modules. As a teaching method, SUPP uses a combination of lectures, workshops, small group discussions and presentations and discussions in plenary. Active participation of students is expected.</body>

column1: Strategic management consulting is a specialized field of management consulting that focuses on helping organizations develop and execute their strategic plans and achieve their long-term business objectives. It involves working with businesses, government agencies, non-profits, and other entities to provide expert advice, analysis, and guidance in areas related to strategy, leadership, and organizational effectiveness. In this course by delving into the intricacies of this profession, we aim to provide you with a crystal-clear view of the routines, challenges, and rewarding aspects that define consultancy. Given the highly competitive consultancy job market, our course places a strong emphasis on hands-on skills needed during job hunting procedures, encompassing CV and SOP preparation, LinkedIn profile optimization, case study practice, and interview preparation.
For this course, attendance is neither mandatory nor part of the assessment.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

• Strategic management consulting is a specialized field of management consulting that focuses on helping organizations develop and execute their strategic plans and achieve their long-term business objectives. It involves working with businesses, government agencies, non-profits, and other entities to provide expert advice, analysis, and guidance in areas related to strategy, leadership, and organizational effectiveness.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/110714,2023,Strategisch Human Resource Management,Nederlands,Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences,,['AL van Zijl, MSc', 'dr. B Vermeeren']",,"Inhoud

<meta http-equiv=""content-type"" content=""text/html; charset=utf-8"" /><style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }</style></head>

In het vak Strategisch Human Resource Management (SHRM) wordt ingegaan op de strategische inzet van arbeid in publieke organisaties. Hierbij staat de afstemming tussen het HR-beleid en de organisatiestrategie centraal. Deze afstemming is een voortdurend proces, waarbij zowel aanpassingen in de organisatie als in het personeelsinstrumentarium nodig zijn om op de lange termijn een bijdrage aan de organisatieprestaties te kunnen leveren. Vanuit de diverse strategische benaderingen in de HRM literatuur wordt het afstemmingsproces in publieke organisaties benaderd, waarbij actuele ontwikkelingen in de omgeving van deze organisaties een bepalende rol spelen. Het vak SHRM bouwt voort op basiskennis over HRM, zoals in Werken in de Publieke Sector (B3) aan de orde is gekomen. Verder biedt het vak een raamwerk waarop in de MHRV vakken Verandermanagement en HRM in de Publieke Sector wordt voortgebouwd.

<meta http-equiv=""content-type"" content=""text/html; charset=utf-8"" /><style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }</style></head>
<body>Na afloop van de cursus is de student in staat om:

column2: • te beschrijven wat de kernbenaderingen binnen het veld van Strategisch Human Resource Management (SHRM) zijn;
• te beredeneren welke theorieën en concepten bij de verschillende benaderingen van SHRM horen;
• uit te leggen wat de relatie is tussen ontwikkelingen in de omgeving van publieke organisaties en het SHRM van deze organisaties;
• uit te leggen onder welke voorwaarden SHRM bijdraagt aan de prestaties van publieke organisaties;
• onderzoek op het terrein van SHRM te beoordelen op wetenschappelijke kwaliteit en toepasbaarheid voor de praktijk.

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/116655,2023,Strategisch bedrijfsplan,Nederlands,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,"['dr. JJ Nijholt', 'PJ de Wilde - Mes']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: In dit vak voer je een strategische analyse uit en geef je advies aan een bestaand bedrijf. Je doet dit in teams van vijf studenten. Je zult meerdere keren op bedrijfsbezoek gaan, op zoek gaan naar informatie over de markt en omgeving van het bedrijf, en uiteindelijk een goed onderbouwd en praktisch relevant rapport inleveren - bij de universiteit, maar ook bij het bedrijf zelf.

Veel studenten kijken terug op SBP als een van de leukste en meest uitdagende ervaringen tijdens hun opleiding. Je doet praktijkervaring op in strategisch advies, je kunt de vaardigheden toepassen die je tijdens het eerste jaar hebt opgedaan en je krijgt waardevol inzicht in hoe bedrijven echt 'werken'. Helaas is SBP voor sommige studenten juist een heel frustrerende ervaring, omdat ze ontdekken hoe moeilijk het kan zijn om met teamleden en bedrijven samen te werken. De beste tip die we je kunnen geven om optimaal van dit vak te profiteren, is binnen je team duidelijke regels en afspraken te maken en op tijd op zoek te gaan naar een interessant bedrijf dat graag met jullie wil samenwerken

Studenten moeten daarom tijdens blok 2 en voordat ze met het vak beginnen, twee Qualifying Assignments uitvoeren: Teamformatie en Bedrijfsregistratie. Je moet hiervoor een team van vijf studenten samenstellen, een teamcontract opstellen, en een bedrijf vinden dat met jullie wil samenwerken. Bedrijven moeten aan bepaalde criteria voldoen om geschikt te worden gevonden. Studenten die deze assignments niet uitvoeren, kunnen niet aan het vak deelnemen. Tijdens twee hoorcolleges in blok 2 worden deze assignments aangekondigd en toegelicht. De inschrijving voor het team verloopt via SIN-Online en is mogelijk vanaf 27 oktober t/m 15 november.

In blok 3 en 4 voer je met je team vier opdrachten uit. Via kennisclips zul je instructies en tips krijgen over de inhoud van deze opdrachten. Vóór de deadlines van de opdrachten krijg je de mogelijkheid je tutor te spreken tijdens een vragenuurtje. Als de opdrachten ingeleverd zijn, worden ze in werkgroepen gepresenteerd en bediscussieerd. Je ontvangt van je tutor ook schriftelijke feedback op de opdrachten. Dee schriftelijke feedback moet je gebruiken om de inhoud te verbeteren.
De inhoud van deze opdrachten vormt de basis van je eindrapport, dat je tegen het einde van het studiejaar inlevert.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }
• toepassen van vaardigheden in teamwerk, inclusief het maken van een ‘Team Contract’ en daarin vastgelegde afspraken en regels naleven.
• toepassen van vaardigheden in projectmanagement, inclusief tijdsmanagement en planning.
• toepassen van vaardigheden in schrijven, presenteren en argumenteren.
• logisch en consistent toepassen van een beperkt aantal strategische concepten en tools op een bestaand bedrijf.
• begrijpen van beperkingen en toepasbaarheid van verschillende databronnen voor verschillende analyses.
<style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Business strategy is a field of study concerned with developing the understanding of why some firms are more successful than others. To succeed, managers must develop the resources and capabilities needed to gain and sustain advantage in competitive markets—traditional and emerging. The way in which organisations attempt to develop such competitive advantage constitutes the essence of their strategy. This course introduces the concept of strategic management through readings, discussion and case analyses, and considers the basic direction and goals of an organisation, the environment (social, political, technological, economic and global factors), industry and market structure, and organisational strengths and weaknesses. The emphasis is on the development and successful implementation of strategy in different types of firms across industries.

The class is structured with (guest) lectures to present theoretical concepts and how those apply in practice. The PBL sessions as well as the strategic case analysis and written report ensure that students understand and apply the concepts during each class session.

<meta http-equiv=""content-type"" content=""text/html; charset=utf-8"" /><style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }</style></head>

column2: • Define and understand the concept of strategy
• Identify and evaluate the key strategic choices available to organizations
• Demonstrate and raise awareness of the main issues involved in managing strategically
• Understand and apply relevant theoretical concepts and frameworks of strategic management to organizations
• To apply the knowledge obtained through this course to diagnose the reasons for good or bad performance and make recommendations on how improvements can be realized

column1: This minor combines (online) classroom (case) workshops and consulting projects.

column2: • In the workshops you will present and discuss real world strategy consultancy cases and other relevant topics. Moreover, you will work on consultancy case assignments (among others, with coaching by guests from strategy consulting firms).

column1: This minor is relevant for you if you are considering a career in (strategy) consulting, but you will also benefit from your new knowledge and skills if you pursue other careers.  Alumni of the course regularly let us know how it has benefited their careers. Some are consultants but many are also still using the learned techniques in their non-consulting related jobs. We hope that you will join them.

• Structure and analyze these issues to develop valuable new insights
• Develop hypotheses about potential strategies for effectively addressing these issues

column1: https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/116915,2023,Strategy and Economics of Platforms,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,['dr. DK Zegners'],,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Questions that will be covered in the course are:

column2: • What are the distinct characteristics of platforms and markets with network effects?
• Why do some platforms become dominant, while others remain in their niche status?
• What are important strategies for firms in platform markets?
• How is pricing in platform markets distinct from pricing in traditional markets?
• How do platforms attract and manage producers of complementary products?
• Why are standards so important in platform markets and how do firms compete in standards battles?
• How to regulate and conduct public policy in platform markets?

column1: The course will connect the knowledge that students have gained in their core courses such as Information Strategy or undergraduate courses on strategy and digital economics to a more advanced and rigorous knowledge of the relevant concepts in platform markets. </body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Many of the most successful companies of the digital age such as Google, Facebook, Apple, Microsoft or Amazon can be characterized as platforms. A platform connects distinct user groups, thereby creating value by enabling interactions between these groups. They are governed by market forces such as network effects that are distinct from traditional markets and therefore have attracted the attention of scholars in strategy and economics, but also policy makers and business gurus.

The goal of this course is to introduce students to current research on platforms from the fields of strategy and economics and apply it to management and public policy related questions on platform markets.   </body>

https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/113999,2023,Strategy of Innovation,Engels,Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University",,"['K Borner', 'SGM Langeveld, MSc', 'V Marchon']",,"Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Whether an organization innovates determines whether it survives. It does not take a world-wide crisis for an organization to realize that the status quo will not be enough. And it is not only the multi-national corporations like Amazon that need to innovate, it is the restaurant at the corner, the local charity, and even national governments see the need for innovation. The question is not whether to innovate, but how.

In this course you learn why organizations struggle to innovate and what to do about it. The course is organized around three broad questions such that each question will be addressed in a specific module:

column2: How can organizations capture the value that they generate?
How can organizations and managers deliver value?

column1: The first part starts with necessity that organizations need to generate value in an environment that is constantly in motion. We will study the typologies and evolution of change in the environment and discuss tools that can help managers make sense of their environments. An important element in this module is that change in an environment does not always occur independent of the organizations, but organizations are both subjects and agents of change.
The second part will explore how organizations can capture the value that they created. We will discuss how organizations can use patents, complementary assets and standards in a strategic manner.
Third, we will discuss several ways how organizations can deliver value by executing their innovation strategy, and by building dynamic capabilities.
The place of this course in the Management of Innovation master

This course marks the beginning of your journey to become a leader of innovation. Strategy and Organization of Innovation will cover the macro perspective, i.e. the perspective of organizations. After this you will focus more on a process or individual level perspective in Idea Management and Idea Implementation.

Strategy of Innovation gives you an introduction and overview to the world of innovation. We will cover important concepts that you will revisit throughout your journey. Overall, this course will equip you with the necessary knowledge and skills that help you provide sound analysis and advice on innovation challenges by organizations and managers at a strategic level. With such knowledge and skills you will be able to understand how to create an innovation culture and what it takes to create successful innovation process.

Attendance is mandatory for all students. Students may be excused for a maximum of one session (e.g., for an interview or due to sickness) without repercussions. Failing to attend any additional session requires notifying the teaching assistant of the course prior to the beginning of that session. Regardless of the underlying cause, students must deliver one additional assignment to compensate for each of the sessions that they did not attend. Students must submit the additional assignments following the course guidelines, failing to do so will cause the student to fail the course. Students experiencing long-term personal circumstances (e.g., chronic illness, serious first-degree family circumstances, top sport status, etc.) that affect their attendance and, more generally, their study progress must contact RSM MSc. student advisers to discuss their study planning and progress.

column1: Met het vak Structuur en Financiering van de Gezondheidszorg (SFG) wordt kennis en inzicht verschaft in de organisatiestructuur en de financiering van de Nederlandse gezondheidszorg.

column1: <body>Het vak Sturing van Complexe Vraagstukken gaat over de vraag wat complexe vraagstukken anders maakt dan klassieke beleidsproblemen en welke gevolgen dit heeft voor de sturing van overheden en andere (semi-)publieke organisaties.</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Na het doorlopen van de module kan de student:
- Complexe vraagstukken in kaart brengen en theoretisch duiden.
- Analyseren hoe (semi-)publieke organisaties in complexe vraagstukken probleemdefinities (re)construeren en hoe dat hun handelen in de vraagstukken beïnvloedt.
- Analyseren waar beleidsleren en –innovatie rond complexe vraagstukken optreden of juist uitblijven.
- Ontwerpen van passende sturingsvormen voor complexe vraagstukken in een concrete casus
https://eur.osiris-student.nl/student/osiris/owc/cursussen/110667,2023,Sturing van economische activiteit,Nederlands,Erasmus School of Social and Behavioural Sciences,,['prof.dr. P Mascini'],,Inhoud

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: <body>Economische activiteit zorgt aan de ene kant voor welvaart, werkgelegenheid en ontplooiingsmogelijkheden. Aan de andere kant is ze ook schadelijk voor de veiligheid en gezondheid van werknemers, consumenten en burgers en voor het milieu. Van oudsher vervult de overheid een centrale rol in de beheersing van de schaduwkanten van economische activiteit. Hierbij produceert de markt en ziet de overheid erop toe dat dit niet te zeer ten koste gaat van publieke doelen als veiligheid, gezondheid en milieu. In de afgelopen decennia zijn ook bedrijven, kritische consumenten en actiegroeperingen een steeds belangrijkere rol gaan spelen in de sturing van economische activiteit. Hierbij valt te denken aan zelfregulering consumentenboycots, certificering en accreditatie. Er is met andere woorden sprake van een verschuiving van overheidssturing naar maatschappelijke sturing, ook wel aangeduid als ‘the shift from government to governance’. Deze verschuiving vindt plaats in een context van grensoverschrijdende productieketens die gepaard gaan met milieuproblemen, uitbuiting en onderbetaling en van inspanningen om de risico’s die gepaard gaan met mondiale productieketens te reduceren. Als gevolg van de toenemende participatie van niet-statelijke actoren in de bescherming en bevordering van publieke doelen, verandert de traditionele rol van sturende overheden, terwijl de wisselwerking tussen statelijke en niet-statelijke actoren aan belang wint. Dit vak gaat over de verhouding en verschuiving van verantwoordelijkheden met betrekking tot de sturing van economische activiteit in drie sociale domeinen: de staat, de markt en het maatschappelijk middenveld. Gebruikmakend van moderne sociaalwetenschappelijke theorieën en perspectieven verkent deze module de taken en verantwoordelijkheden die verschillende actoren afzonderlijk en in onderlinge wisselwerking vervullen waar het de sturing van economische activiteit betreft en de verschuivingen die hierin plaatsvinden. Hierbij komen casussen aan bod over misstanden in de vee- en vleessector, giftige organisatieculturen en uitbuiting, onderdrukking en onderbetaling in de kledingindustrie, van sekswerkers en door uitzendbureaus.</body>

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: Na (a) het bijwonen van de colleges, (b) het voltooien van de opdrachten en (c) het bespreken van de opdrachten binnen de werkgroepen, kunnen studenten:
2. Verschillende perspectieven op de verschuiving van overheidstoezicht naar maatschappelijke sturing vergelijken.
3. Verschillende vormen van sturing van grensoverschrijdende productieketens vergelijken.
4. Verschillende vormen van sturing in organisaties vergelijken.
5. Beschrijven en verklaren hoe actiegroepen sociale druk uitoefenen op bedrijven en overheden en welke reacties dit uitlokt.
6. De eigenschappen van toezichtsnetwerken beschrijven en de populariteit en het functioneren van toezichtssnetwerken verklaren.
7. Gelegaliseerde prostitutie als casus van interactie in een sturingsnetwerk vanuit een governmentality perspectief illustreren.

column2: <style type=""text/css"">body { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial } table { font-size: 9pt; font-family: Arial }

column1: De toetsing bestaat uit een schriftelijk (her)tentamen met open vragen.

Er geldt een aanwezigheidsplicht tijdens de werkcolleges (d.w.z. ten hoogste één werkcollege mag worden gemist). Voorafgaande aan de wekelijkse werkcolleges wordt men gevraagd een opdracht te maken en in te leveren via Canvas. De opdrachten zijn individueel. Indien minimaal zes van de zeven opdrachten als voldoende worden beoordeeld (en men aan de aanwezigheidsplicht heeft voldaan), vervalt één tentamenvraag. Voor dit onderdeel krijgt men dan 20 van de 100 punten. De opdrachten zelf kunnen niet worden herkanst. Het desbetreffende onderdeel van het tentamen is namelijk de herkansing.
